column4: How come "free -m" and System Monitor show about 200 mb difference in the currently used ram?
the used column in the +/- buffers row is the same as the number in the system monitor for me
oh, yeah, I was looking at the Mem: line.
ah.. that's without all the buffers used for caching files and stuff
or rather.. the mem line includes those
so actually, only the memory indicated by the Mem: line is available, but if different buffers are cleared (which isn't bad), as much as given in the +/- ... line is available?
right.. and the buffers are cleared automatically if a process needs more memory
thanks.
you're welcome
cygnus something?
cygwin.. that was it
and clearscreen: but on www.cygwin.com it says " Cygwin is not a way to run native linux apps on Windows.  You have to rebuild your application from source if you want it to run on Windows. ".
oh.. my bad then.. never really used cygwin myself
isn't there a switch you need to use for it to actually fix things? have you checked "man fsck" ?
I think to simulate I would have to use the -N option?
I think I found it: "-r"!
-r might work.. there's more info in "man fsck.vfat"
right, thanks I only looked at "man fsck". Well anyway, -r worked! Thanks!
you're welcome
just ask your question.
try asking in #kubuntu, they may know more about kde
#kubuntu is empty
nope.. it's full of people.. try again
